choices.text:
what is a merism?
a type of mathematical function that takes two arguments and returns true or false.

## Example 1 from the APL language, in its original version by Mike Naberezny at http://www.cs.utexas.edu/users//nab/Apl4.html (see also: [https:\/\/en\_gb\-uclwebstores\-2\.0\.1a2f3e6d\-1c7v9w5mz8qkjyhxnrlnpnlcgvyp](http://www.cs\\/users//nab/\#Apl4))

> _"I've been using APL for a long time, and I think it is quite good at the basics of mathematical functions in general; but when you have to do things like finding out whether two numbers are equal or not—and that can be done with just one function call! — And then there'll come some more complexity."_
> [http://www\-cs\\/users//nab/\#Apl4](https
